results.title: I hate to lose
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed in the predominantly anglophone, upper middle-class Montreal riding of Westmount during the months preceding Quebec’s history-making election of November 15, 1976. ‘I hate to lose’ documents a play within a play, a brisk, natural drama that sparkles with humour. The camera follows closely behind leading political contenders George Springate, Nick Auf der Maur, and Harold ‘Shorty’ Fairhead, chronicling the unfolding of an election campaign on the local hustings, and gleaning retrospective insights into aglophone neglect of the Parti Quebecois’s swelling popularity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 9
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sharp, John Gauci and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Times are tough and the economy is failing. When the factory heads agree that the only way to save costs is to downsize, Alan must use all his abilities to try and save the jobs of his friends in the factory. Eventually Alan decides to leave and return to the country to begin his career as a writer.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 8
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sharp, John Gauci and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Following his dismissal from his previous job, Alan finds work at a boot factory in Melbourne, quickly proving his worth and moving from part time to full time employment. Despite emersing himself in his work at the factory and his writing, Alan notices Biddy, a quiet employee at the factory, and the two quickly become a couple, leading to a series of events including the purchase of Alan’s first car.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 7
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, John Gauci and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. When a story he submits is rejected, Alan, age 20, returns to the city to work. Quickly applying for a clerical position, Alan is offered the job, on the condition he accepts less than the award wage. On the condition that if after 6 months, his employer, Mrs. Smalpeck, is pleased with his work, she raise his wage to match those of equal capability, he agrees. Boarding at a local boarding house run by the eccentric Mrs. Birdsworth, Alan continues his observation of the world around him.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 6
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, John Gauci and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. After leaving his previous job, Alan discovers finding work is not as easy as it seems, continually being rejected due to his disability. While his constant walks through the city looking for work, have enabled him to meet a number of people and write their stories, he soon decides to return home and concentrate on his writing.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 5
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, John Gauci and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Adult Alan (played by Lewis Fitzgerald), is taken into the city by his father, and soon is employed as a clerk. Boarding in the local pub means meeting a wide variety of people, and Alan’s country naivete is quickly discovered and exploited by the locals. Eventually Alan settles in and makes friends and continues to maintain his notebook and his ambition to be a writer.

results.title: I Can't See
results.brief_description: Eye protection is often one of the most important features in a company’s safety program.. Clearly designated areas, regulations and warnings are not always observed, with the result that many employees put themselves at risk of injury to one of the most vital senses. “I Can’t See” is a powerful film which rejects the attitude of some employees that eye protection is a nuisance its need overstated, the “won’t happen to me” attitude. At the same time, we see it being used correctly in several different industrial situations.

results.title: I can't hear
results.creator_credit: Peter Rawson, Peter Griffiths and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Arthur Freeman is a wood machinist in a medium sized industrial firm. Over the years he has, whenever possible, dodged the wearing of ear protection. He is now suffering from noise induced hearing loss. A fictionalised drama.

results.title: I Call It Home
results.brief_description: This program examines the homelessness in Melbourne with a specific focus on a Government redevelopment plan to provide improved sheltering services for single men. Councillors, welfare workers and the men themselves, discuss the reality of the system and what the Government plan will provide.

results.title: I am Joe's heart. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to show the effects of lack of exercise, heavy smoking, and overindulgence in fatty foods and alcohol on the heart. Shows how the heart and circulatory system function and stresses exercise and healthful living.
